pacman
Class Game

java.lang.Object
  pacman.Game

public class Game
extends Object

A class representing a Pac-Man game and its current state. By passing different parameters to the constructors it is possible to create modified versions of the game. The key method is playGame().

Game

public Game(List<GhostPlayer> ghostPlayers,
            Display display)
Makes new game, which is set to an initial State.

Parameters:
dots - the Set of Locations that have dots
playerNames - a List of String names of the players, where 0 is always Pac-Man, and other players are ghosts

playGame

public int[] playGame(PacManPlayer pacMan,
                      int numLives,
                      LocationSet dotLocations)
Parameters:
pacMan -
numLives -
Returns:
the final game statistics represented as an int array, where the 0th element is the number of points accumulated, the 1st element is the number of levels completed, and the 2nd element is the total game time.
